title: Our Country: The Shaping of America from Roosevelt to Reagan
description: A broad account of how Americans shaped their politics through the decades since the Depression. In contrast to most contemporary political historians, Barone (senior writer, US news and world report ) argues that Americans have more often charted their political fortunes by cultural allegiances regional, ethnic, religious, rural, and urban than by economic struggles. Annotation copyright Book News, Inc. Portland, Or.
author: Michael Barone
